article_title: How to pay for your dental work
article_text: For those with insurance, the amount covered has barely budged over the past several decades. According to the GAO study, the median maximum benefit was $1,500 in 2008 (the last year for which figures are available), about what it has been for the past 30 years. (The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act eliminated the annual limit for people younger than 19 in most plans, but it still applies to everyone else.)

article_metadata.news_keywords: Dental, dental plans, dentistry, dental clinics, dental work, dental coverage, Consumer Reports, Health, Health Insurance, Money

article_metadata.description: Dentistry can be expensive, especially if you need major work. Consumer Reports experts tell you how to trim the cost.

article_summary:
(The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act eliminated the annual limit for people younger than 19 in most plans, but it still applies to everyone else.)
According to the GAO study, the median maximum benefit was $1,500 in 2008 (the last year for which figures are available), about what it has been for the past 30 years.
For those with insurance, the amount covered has barely budged over the past several decades.
